intro: Connellia varadarajanii, commonly known as the Varadarajan's connellia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the Indian subcontinent, particularly found in regions of India and Nepal. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Connellia varadarajanii is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
